page.title: 05A Nature Reserve in Creeting
page.content: A 4 1/2 acre area of damp woodland known as Fen Alder Carr was bought by the Suffolk County Council in 1980 as part of the Gipping Valley Countryside and Recreation Project, and was opened to the public soon after as a nature reserve. A wooden walkway winds between willows, alders, ash and field maples and throughout lies a dense carpet of herbs including meadowsweet, willow herb and angelica. There are many interesting plants, which include marsh marigolds, bitter sweet, ramsons, wild arum and water crowfoot. Fungi grow on mossy stumps and further on, a pond provides a breeding ground for toads, damsel flies and water insects. It is a natural habitat for birds. The reserve is maintained by the Manpower Services Commission.
